summary: Tian is an immunologist by training with a passion for drug development and commercialization. She is detail-oriented and strong in execution. She has 10 years of research experience in academia and industry combined.

currentPositions.description:
Advancing the development of novel tumor microenvironment-targeted antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs) for the treatment of heterogeneous solid tumors.
- Leading preclinical and MOA studies to better understand the wider applicability of the company's lead oncology assets
- Creating comprehensive data packages (target validation, proof-of-concept, xenograft studies, PD and PK) for a new immunomodulating ADC asset
- Building data room and presentation decks to facilitate collaboration and due diligence
- Supporting business development efforts through competitive landscape analysis 
- Cultivating and maintaining strong relationships with academic collaborators and industrial partners to facilitate research projects
currentPositions.title: Research Scientist

educations.schoolName: University of Toronto School of Continuing Studies

headline: Immuno-oncology Scientist | Content Creator

message.text: Great news from Tubulis GmbH! The completion of the Series B2 financing round will give us the opportunity to support not only the clinical evaluation of our lead ADC candidates TUB-030 and TUB-040, but also to further expand our pipeline. Happy to be part of the team and to share their vision of delivering the true value of ADCs!

Today marks a pivotal moment in the evolution of Tubulis. We have successfully closed an upsized and oversubscribed €128 million Series B2 #financing co-led by ​EQT Life Sciences​ and Nextech Invest, with participation from new US-based funds, ​Frazier Life Sciences​ and Deep Track Capital, as well as all of our existing investors.

The support of this syndicate of leading global biotech investors underscores the potential of our unique approach to pioneering the next wave of truly differentiated, disease-specific #ADC therapeutics. With this funding, we are well-positioned to advance our next-generation ADCs into clinical evaluation and achieve clinical proof-of-concept for our lead #SolidTumor candidates, TUB-040 and TUB-030. The proceeds will also support the further development of our technology platforms to unlock novel payloads and the establishment of a US subsidiary to expand our corporate footprint.

We look forward to working with ​Christoph Broja​ and ​Kanishka Pothula​ as new members of our Supervisory Board to realize our vision of providing new, high-quality treatment options for many hard-to-treat #cancers.

Read the full PR here: https://bit.ly/3IxICOZ
